articles.title: Got a cough coming on? Don’t soldier on. For heaven’s sake, march homewards
articles.description: Based on the cavalier public behaviour I’ve witnessed recently, I fear we’ve forgotten the hard-won lessons of COVID.
articles.content:
The full-body cough is back. You may remember them from pre-COVID days, when people with bad coughs or a cold often felt free to move at large without embarrassment or mask.

articles.title: Why riots erupted in Los Angeles after ICE raids, and what happened next
articles.description: Immigration and Customs Enforcement raids have sparked riots across Los Angeles, leading to the National Guard being called in. Here's a recap of events.
articles.content:
Los Angeles is experiencing its second day of significant riots, with the National Guard being called in on Saturday night, local time.
Here's a quick guide to what is going on:

articles.description: While standard health insurance policies typically include brain tumour treatments, gaps in coverage and high out-of-pocket expenses remain concerns.

articles.title: G7 Summit: Canada's PM Carney says New Delhi ‘belongs at the table’. Why is India important? Mint decodes
articles.description: Experts say given the increasing economic heft of the country, India cannot be outside the major policy issues confronting the West, an opinion Canada's Carney seconded on Friday. India surpassed Japan to become the world's fourth-largest economy in May this year.
articles.content:
Canada Prime Minister Mark Carney, while highlighting India's economic stature and strategic role in global supply chains, said that the country's presence is “essential” at the upcoming G7 Summit.
